title.narrative: Sanitation and Hygiene Programme in Cambodia

description.narrative:
The Cambodia Rural Sanitation and Hygiene Improvement Program (CR-SHIP), targets 5,600 villages in provinces where current sanitation coverage is below 50% to increase sustained access to improved sanitation and promote proper hygiene practices. The program will directly benefit more than 400,000 households in rural areas of Cambodia, indirectly reaching more than a million households. Its primary objectives are to promote the sustainable practices of consistent use of latrines, hand-washing with soap, and drinking only safe water in rural communities; and to develop and strengthen capacity in government, local authorities, and local NGOs in promoting improved sanitation and hygiene.
To achieve the two objectives, the program will pursue four specific outcomes:
1. People achieve better hygiene outcomes through changed sanitation behaviors;
2. Capacity is created for the sustainable spread of improved sanitation and hygiene;
3. Government agencies allocate increased resources for sanitation and hygiene; and
4. Successful and innovative approaches in sanitation and hygiene are identified, evaluated and scaled up.
The program utilizes and delivers its services through non-hardware subsidized approaches Community-led Total Sanitation (CLTS); School and Community WASH (SC-WASH); Sanitation Marketing; information, education, and communication (IEC) and behavior change communication (BCC) campaigns - that have been proven successful in increasing sanitation access, particularly among poor households and communities in the country. In addition to sanitation and hygiene promotion, the program will also include components on capacity building, advocacy, documentation, evaluation, and dissemination, and coordination.
